newsitem.title: USA: White House sees no reason for US expansion to end.
newsitem.headline: White House sees no reason for US expansion to end.

text.p: The White House said on Monday it saw no reason why the U.S. economy's nearly six-year expansion should not continue, with the country well-placed to enjoy continued low unemployment as well as low inflation.
"There is no forseeable reason why this expansion cannot continue," said the annual "Economic Report of the President" prepared by President Bill Clinton's Council of Economic Advisers (CEA).
"Most recent expansions have ended because of rising inflation, financial imbalances or inventory overhangs," the report added. "None of these conditions exists at present."

The report said household finances are sound, business inventories are lean and inflation remains under control, adding "the ability of the economy to sustain low unemployment and low inflation is the best it has been in years."

"The rate of inflation in 1996 has been elevated by rapid increases in food and energy prices," the CEA added. "These prices are not expected to grow any faster than other prices over the next year, and so the rate of increase in the CPI is expected to edge lower."
